title: 110_hr4249
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forests Land Exchange Act of 2007". The Act defines key terms such as "map," "Grand Creek, LLC," "Federal land," "non-Federal land," "National Forests," and "Secretary." The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE, ARAPAHO-ROOSEVELT NATIONAL FORESTS, COLORADO. Land exchange in Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forests, Colorado involves conveyances by Grand Creek, LLC and the United States. Grand Creek, LLC must offer acceptable title for non-Federal land within 30 days. Upon receipt of title, the Secretary of Agriculture will convey Federal land to Grand Creek, LLC. Appraisals will determine values for the land exchange. The land exchange in Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forests, Colorado involves conveyances by Grand Creek, LLC and the United States. Appraisals will determine values for the exchange, following specific standards. If the value of non-Federal land exceeds that of Federal land, the Secretary may adjust values by reducing acreage or making a cash payment to Grand Creek, LLC. The Secretary may accept a cash equalization payment from Grand Creek, LLC if the value of Federal land exceeds that of non-Federal land in the land exchange, as per the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. Additionally, exchange costs must be covered by Grand Creek, LLC to expedite the process and save administrative costs. The Secretary will require Grand Creek, LLC to pay for land surveys and appraisals for the land exchange. Additionally, Grand Creek, LLC must allow public access to land for unimpeded access to St. Mary's Glacier. SEC. 4. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF LAND.

Upon acquisition of non-Federal land and conveyance of Federal land under section 3, the Secretary will adjust the boundary of the National Forests accordingly. The non-Federal land acquired under section 3 will be managed as part of the National Forests, following applicable laws and regulations.
